location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 89: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell reports the arrival at Bushire of the Nuwabi Hajeea and her two sons, Secunder and Mahomed Mirza. Hennell states that the Nuwabi Hajeea is exceedingly reluctant to have her law suit, which regards the possession of the Cazeroon [Kāzerūn] estates, adjusted before the moojtchid [mujtahid] of Bushire. However, Hennell promises to do all in his power to have the affair settled there.
